response.answer_text: As it turns out, genetics do seem to play a role. Perhaps surprisingly however, they have a larger influence on our appetite than our metabolism. People who gain weight faster seem to do so as they feel hungrier more often than those who are naturally thin.Apr 27, 2019 Our Appetite is Controlled by Our Genes | Genetics And ... The appetite genes: Why some of us are born to eat too much ... www.newscientist.com › article › mg23431281-600-the... May 31, 2017 — Subtle differences in how we respond to food, driven by our genes, are the true reason we can struggle to keep to the weight we want to be.
